result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Petition and Order Permitting Attorney to Withdraw

Defendant Charles A. Towsley in custody, appears in court with attorney Gregg E. Waterman.  Jennifer Alleman Harper appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Two cases called together (14CF54 & 14CF59). Atty W. presents documents to the Court. Court reads statement of negotiated plea, plea before the court is 14CF54 be dismissed and read in, 14CF59-nc plea for 40 months prison, 13 init confinement, 27 extended supervision, imposed and stayed for 3 years probation, 4 months jail as a condition along with other conditions. Court's colloquy re. plea questionnaire/waiver of rights.Court is not willing to go forward with sentencing today, will order a PSI. Comment by Atty Waterman. No objection by DA. Further colloquy. Def pleads NC to 14CF59. Court finds factual basis and accepts NC plea, finds plea was freely, voluntarily and intelligently made, accepts waiver of rights. Court finds def guilty for count 1 in 14CF59. Motion to dismiss and read in 14CF54. Court dismisses 14CF54. PSI will be ordered for 14CF59.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 25, 2014 at 03:30 pm.

Attorney Gregg E. Waterman in court for Defendant Charles A. Towsley. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer Alleman Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. DA gives status of case, offer has been given to defense. Requests plea/sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 25, 2014 at 03:30 pm.
email directive from JA re. scheduling

Prosecuting Atty Jennifer Alleman Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Charles A. Towsley not in court. Attorney Gregg E. Waterman not in court. Statutory victims are in court. Court requests matter be reset (Atty W to contact his office directly). Telephone message left for Atty W.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: Attorney Gregg E. Waterman in court for Defendant Charles A. Towsley. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer Alleman Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Deputy T. Johnson is sworn and questioned on direct by DA. Cross by Atty Waterman. DA asks for bindover. Objection by defense. Court binds over defendant and will set for arraignment. DA provides copy of information to Court. Defense notes defendant wishes to exercise his right to judicial substitution but does not object to having arraignment done today by Judge Sharp. Defense notes defendant wishes to preserve the right to substition in 14CF59. Def. stands mute to all charges in 14CF54, clerk is directed to enter NG pleas on his behalf. Scheduling will be established once judicial assignment has been made.
Preliminary hearing on September 12, 2014 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Charles A. Towsley in court with Atty Waterman. Prosecuting Atty Amy Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin. Court informs def of the charges/max possible penalties. Atty W enters NG plea. Court informs def of right to prelim, Atty W requests scheduling for prelim.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 12, 2014 at 11:00 am.
